org.openhab.binding.velux.internal.bridge.slip.io

Class SSLconnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openhab.binding.velux.internal.bridge.slip.io.SSLconnection

  • @NonNullByDefault
class SSLconnection
extends java.lang.Object
    Transport layer supported by the Velux bridge.

    SLIP-based 2nd Level I/O interface towards the Velux bridge.

    It provides methods for pre- and post-communication as well as a common method for the real communication.

    • SSLconnection(java.lang.String, int) for establishing the connection,
    • send(byte[]) for sending a message to the bridge,
    • available() for observation whether there are bytes available,
    • receive() for receiving a message from the bridge,
    • close() for tearing down the connection.
    • setTimeout(int) for adapting communication parameters.
    Author:
    Guenther Schreiner - Initial contribution.

      Fake trust manager to suppress any certificate errors, used within SSLconnection(java.lang.String, int) for seamless operation even on self-signed certificates like provided by Velux.

      • trustAllCerts

        private final javax.net.ssl.TrustManager[] trustAllCerts
        Fake trust manager to suppress any certificate errors, used within SSLconnection(java.lang.String, int) for seamless operation even on self-signed certificates like provided by Velux.

      • SSLconnection

        SSLconnection(java.lang.String host,
              int port)
       throws java.net.ConnectException,
              java.io.IOException,
              java.net.UnknownHostException
        Constructor to setup and establish a connection.
        Parameters:
        host - as String describing the Service Access Point location i.e. hostname.
        port - as String describing the Service Access Point location i.e. TCP port.
        Throws:
        java.net.ConnectException - in case of unrecoverable communication failures.
        java.io.IOException - in case of continuous communication I/O failures.
        java.net.UnknownHostException - in case of continuous communication I/O failures.

    • Method Detail

      • isReady

        boolean isReady()
        Method to query the readiness of the connection.
        Returns:
        ready as boolean for an established connection.

      • send

        void send(byte[] packet)
   throws java.io.IOException
        Method to pass a message towards the bridge.
        Parameters:
        packet - as Array of bytes to be transmitted towards the bridge via the established connection.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case of a communication I/O failure.

      • available

        boolean available()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Method to verify that there is message from the bridge.
        Returns:
        true if there are any bytes ready to be queried using receive().
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case of a communication I/O failure.

      • receive

        byte[] receive()
        throws java.io.IOException
        Method to get a message from the bridge.
        Returns:
        packet as Array of bytes as received from the bridge via the established connection.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case of a communication I/O failure.

    throws java.io.IOException
        Destructor to tear down a connection.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case of a communication I/O failure.

      • setTimeout

        void setTimeout(int timeoutMSecs)
        Parameter modification.
        Parameters:
        timeoutMSecs - the maximum duration in milliseconds for read operations.
